DOC.brief_summary: Feasibility Study Demonstrate Safety Angioshield System Provide Mechanical Support Vein Grafts Used CABG Surgery .
DOC.detailed_description: The study design investigate feasibility use applied support ( Angioshield ) saphenous vein use Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery . It feasibility determine safety prior launch large pivotal study . The primary endpoint , 30-day safety , assess record report adverse event surgery throughout investigation 30-day follow-up visit . The secondary endpoint , long term safety patency , assess record report adverse event graft patency ( via serial CT angiogram ) 30 , 90 , 365 day follow-up visit .
DOC.criteria: Subject eligible inclusion investigation he/she : 1. age 18 80 year age , inclusive 2. require CABG surgery due atherosclerotic coronary artery disease minimum two SVGs , one use bypass stenosis main Right Coronary artery one used bypass stenosis Circumflex artery territory 3. able give inform write consent 4. willing able complete followup visit procedures 5. treated via medial sternotomy cardiopulmonary bypass surgery 6. adequate saphenous vein 7 . Is candidate transcatheter therapy , PCI Subject exclude participation investigation he/she : 1. currently enrol another clinical investigation 2. unable tolerate comply require postsurgical medication image ( e.g. , anticoagulation regimen ; know allergy contrast agent ) 3. may pregnant lactating , plan become pregnant next 12 month 4. history hypercoagulable state 5. acute MI within last 21 day 6. previous CABG 7. require emergency surgery 8. leave ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) less 35 % 9. target vessel stenosis le 75 % 10. transmural infarct target artery territory 11. serum creatinine great 1.5 mg/dL 12. concomitant surgery kind 13. previous saphenectomy ( See inclusion ) 14. saphenous vein size incompatible treatment range ( i.e. , < 3.5 mm > 5 mm inner diameter ) 15. limb Ischemia nonhealing ulcer 16. moderate severe COPD define FEV 1 less 1 liter 17. CVA last 90 day 18. diffuse disease target vessel inadequate anastomotic touchdown site
